newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia Naphtha/Mogas-Naphtha dip on ample supplies.
newsitem.headline: Asia Naphtha/Mogas-Naphtha dip on ample supplies.

text.p: Singapore gasoline were stable while naphtha slipped with traders concerned that the length in the current bearish market will persist in the near term.
"There are just too much naphtha," said a trader. Talk was heard that there are distressed cargoes near Japan that are seeking homes.
Some traders have estimated that about 700,000 to 800,000 tonnes of naphtha have been shipped to Asia since the arbitrage window from Europe opened in March.
Traders said the arbitrage remained open to the distress of sellers.
Singapore's June naphtha slipped to $20.75/$20.85 per barrel down from $21.00/$21.20.
The fall led to a widening of the June and July contango suggesting that the bearish market have extended to the forward months, said one trader.
"Japanese end users are very laid back, they know they can take their time," he said.
Market attention is also on the Saudi Aramco term naphtha talks to be held in Singapore on Monday.
In the mogas market, a bid was seen for 92-octane supplies at $23.75 against no offers.
Traders said the market remained long with buyers unhurried to cover their requirements.
Singapore weekly stocks for light distillates which comprises gasoline, naphtha, reformate were up from a week ago.
Stocks rose by 291,000 barrels to 7.557 million barrels. Traders said the rise in stocks were within expectations.
(Prices are in dollars per barrel)
MTH FOB SIN BUY/SELL PREV BUY/SELL
JUN NAPHTHA SWAPS 20.75/20.85 21.00/21.20
JUL NAPHTHA SWAPS 21.00/21.10 21.20/21.40
APR GASOLINE SWAPS - - -/- - - - - -/- - -
-- Singapore Newsroom (+65-870 3082)
